Half-Life is a game which has aged surprisingly well, and excels in almost every aspect of its design. Level design, story, pacing, gameplay fun and variety - all of these things kept me hooked into playing it. 

I'm someone who has never played any Half-Life games until this one in 2019, so I had no worries about nostalgia making my playthrough of the game biased. To me, it still holds up even over 20 years later. The game gives you the perfect amount of puzzles and combat, and manages to place them in a way that feels natural. Just went through a long gunfight? You'll now have some downtime to relax and focus on solving a puzzle to progress. Just picked up a new weapon? Here are a few familiar enemies to test it out on. 

I'm glad that there's much more Half-Life content ready for me to enjoy.

So imagine after the massive failure of the Space X rocket they decided to become a company that sells ILLEGAL drugs from an alien border world. You are some dude who works with large amounts of those ILLEGAL drugs in an over-sized test chamber. Sadly though the drug actually had a massive wormhole in it so now aliens that are for sure not budget face huggers are out to murder everybody in the facility, as well as a squid bull chicken, a dog with 20 eyes, slaves, floating slave controllers, generic aliens who might have a hornet nest growing inside of them, and some big baby or something, Also some dude who might be stalking you for whatever reason. Luckily for you, you actually went to boot camp and got trained to use every weapon stored at the Space X ILLEGAL drugs lab AND an alien glove that might have just put a hornet nest inside of you. Halfway through your journey to the surface the AMERICAN AIR-FORCE SHOWS UP AND MURDERS EVERYBODY WHO ENTERS THE SPACE X ILLEGAL DRUGS LAB. They're very stupid though so don't worry. BUT THEN THE AMERICAN GOVERMENT HIRES MANY HITMEN TO KILL YOU BUT THEY ARE STUPID AND CAN'T TELL THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE AMERICAN AIR-FORCE AND YOU. Then you murder them but then some dudes are like, "Please kill this giant baby in the border world else earth will implode." So you do that in the most tedious chapters of your life (aside from gonarch's lair. that chapter is good.) After destroying the giant baby the dude stalking you offers a deal and threatens to kill you if you decline. So you accept and you hired or something.

Yes while 4 hours may seem like a fairly short time to critique a game, here are my initial thoughts. After all, I have a feeling that I may no longer play this game or I may not even finish this game entirely. There are a lot of things that this game has done to earn my respect. The mobs you encounter in the game are creepy even for 2019. There are times that i almost shit myself looking at the mobs. The weapons are plentiful and truly in this game did i realize that player choice is plentiful as well. I could choose to speedrun the game entirely skipping out on enemies or try to not get hit at all throughout the entire game. However, I do feel that there is a flaw. That flaw is that this game; it did not age well. The character you control slides around the map like butter and many times did i die a stupid death because of it. Not to mention that some puzzles require you as the player to move quickly. Combine that with the movement of a butter melting in a pan and you'll find yourself dissatisfied at the end of the stick. Sure, if i stick through it and finish it, i might find myself actually enjoying the story it has to offer but at the end of the day I wouldn't recommend it. Unless, you whoever is actually taking the time to read this review of an old game (in which case thanks) has been gaming primarily on PC with a keyboard and mouse setup for almost your whole life, then go and buy it. I assure you, you might enjoy it. But as for me, as a person who has gamed primarily on consoles, its a hard pass for me

TL;DR Buy the game if you have been gaming on PC your whole life or enjoys FPS games.

Good: Great arsenal of weapons, fantastic level design, intense combat, variety of aliens and hostile humans to fight. Orange powered armor, flying in the face of good taste. Expansion packs add more weapons, levels, and gameplay.

Bad: Assault rifle (or smg) in this game is really not good compared to the pistol, except at very close range. Sometimes not easy to tell where you are supposed to go next.

Ugly: Nothing. I'm not even going to make a Half Life 3 or Episode 3 joke. It's been over a decade. That's the joke.

Conclusion: I imagine most people associate the term "half life" to this game rather than the actual definition. And for good damn reason.
valve episodio 3 yaaaa

Bruh it's half life. Level design wise, it's a good case study of how to get the most out of a limited space. It's quite impressive how much content is in an otherwise deceivingly small game. There are some glitches/frustratingly unfair parts but hey, it's 20+ years old, so what do you expect?

하프라이프, 명작 중의 명작이자 전설의 시작.
스토리가 있는 FPS게임의 조상격이라고 할 수 있는 게임이자 혁신을 이끈 게임
스토리, 출시년도에 비례한 혁신적인 인공지능, WASD 조작체계 정립, 
레벨 디자인의 표준을 제시 등 장점이 많아서 다 말하지도 못한다.
그래픽이 안좋다 하는 놈들은 출시년도를 봐라;; 고전게임이다.
메타스코어 96점, 두말할 필요도 없다. 
당시 밸브와 게이브 뉴웰의 도전정신까지 느낄수 있는 게임이다.
FPS게임의 조상중의 하나고 긴말 필요 없이 명작이니 사는걸 추천한다.
